data.question: What is the energy gap of polymer 3?
Which polymer exhibited semi-conducting properties?
What is the composition left as residue after the thermal stability evaluation of polymer 3?
What method was used to confirm the transformation from cluster 2 to polymer 3?
What was the ratio of [Et4N]2[SFe3(CO)9], [Cu(MeCN)4][BF4], and dppe used in the synthesis of clusters 1 and 2?
What type of transformation is demonstrated between cluster 2 and polymer 3?
What happens to polymer 3 when exposed to MeCN vapor?
How can the depolymerization process from polymer 3 to cluster 2 be achieved?
data.answer: Via mechanochemical grinding with the addition of drops of organic solvents

data.question: What indicates the degradation of polymer 3 in solutions according to ESI-MS measurement?
data.answer: The major peaks corresponding to [(m3-S)Fe3(CO)9Cu](cid:2) (514.9) and [{SFe3(CO)9}2Cu3](cid:2) (1094.1)

data.question: What is the role of dppe in the properties of polymer 3?
data.answer: It possibly enables electron communication between adjacent SFe3(CO)9Cu2-based units

data.question: Is the transformation from cluster 2 to polymer 3 a single-crystal to single-crystal transformation?
Does polymer 3 represent the first example of a Cu(dppe) Cu-bridged metal carbonyl cluster-based polymer?
Is the energy gap increased from cluster 2 to polymer 3?
Can polymer 3 be obtained by treating cluster 1 with MeCN?
Is the direct solid-state transformation of metal carbonyl clusters in the formation of coordination polymers a well-explored area?
Does the thermal stability evaluation of polymer 3 involve a significant weight loss at temperatures as high as 600 1C?
Is the mechanochemical approach not efficient for the synthesis of organic, inorganic, organometallic, and supramolecular materials?
What is the role of MeCN in the polymerization process of complex 2 to form polymer 3?
data.answer: It initially attacks the Cu2 atom of 2, inducing Fe–Cu and Cu–Cu bond cleavages to form a reactive ‘‘SFe3Cu’’

data.question: What is the result of the thermal stability evaluation of polymer 3?
data.answer: A continuous weight loss of 32.03% at temperatures below 250 1C, corresponding to the loss of MeCN molecules and CO groups

data.question: What does the change in color from brownish-black to reddish-brown indicate when crystals of 2 are exposed to MeCN vapor?
